review: I recently just got my Fire TV Stick and I was very excited on having this device. I finally tested it for the first time today and I noticed that the charger port was loose and it popped out twice before I finally got it in and charging. I was getting disappointed at that point and worried that I have wasted my money on this device because I also have a chromecast and that one lags a bit but this is actually slower than the chromecast. Also the buttons are difficult to press. It gets stuck in the remote as I press to navigate. I don't recommend this product.

review: I was skeptical when I picked up the Fire TV Stick during its initial promotion.  I've been impressed with the usability & responsiveness of the UI.  It's especially good for browsing & watching Amazon content, but even Netflix is quick and the video streams appear to be higher quality than the same streams on my Samsung smart TV.I would say the Chromecast is the best overall streamer at the moment, given the number of integrated apps.  But if you use Amazon video, it makes sense to own both.  I've been using Chromecast for Youtube & HboGO and Fire TV Stick for Amazon & Netflix.  Overall the Fire TV stick is a better at-home experience, but Chromecast fills in the gaps.
